Intervention: Open-label intravenous (IV) bisphosphonate once every 4 weeks (Q4W)
Open-label denosumab 180 mg by subcutaneous injection once every 12 weeks (Q12W)
Eligibility: Patients at least 18 years of age with histologically confirmed solid tumor carcinomas (except lung) or multiple myeloma
Radiographic evidence of 1 or more bone lesions or lytic lesion in myeloma
Urinary N-Telopeptide (uNTx) greater than 50 nM BCE/mM creatinine
More than 2 prior skeletal related events (SRE)
Prior history or current evidence of osteonecrosis/osteomyelitis of the jaw
Active dental or jaw conditions which requires oral surgery
Evidence of impending fracture in weight bearing bones
Pregnancy or breastfeeding. Subjects must be surgically sterile, postmenopausal, or must agree to use effective contraception during the study.
Results: uNTx (Corrected by Creatinine) < 50 Nmol/mmol at Week 13
Urinary N-telopeptide (uNTx) corrected by creatinine (uNTx/Cr) < 50 nmol/mmol at week 13.
Arm/Group Description: Open-label intravenous (IV) bisphosphonate once every 4 weeks (Q4W)
Arm/Group Description: Open-label denosumab 180 mg by subcutaneous injection once every 12 weeks (Q12W)
